lines.text: He's tougher than an old sow's nose.
I saw a big reward sign go up in Hangtown once. Shucks, they brought in sixteen corpses the first week... and there wasn't any of 'em that even looked like the fella!
We're getting a posse together. We'll stop him before he gets started!
You ain't gonna hang nobody without a fair trial!
This place ain't gonna get no Hangtown reputation.
I bet your head feels bigger than an overgrown pumpkin.

I got just the cure for it - an injun remedy. Chief Sitting Bull himself gave me the recipe for learning him how to follow a trail. It cures aches, pains, bunions, calluses, galloping consumption and the seven year itch.
[Roy has just rescued the lovely young Joby from a drunken admirer]
I was going to ask you to have a drink, but that's the same mistake the other fellow made.
lines.character: Roy Rogers, posing as The Carson City Kid

lines.text: Oh, I quit drinking 30, 40 years ago. I guess I'm getting old. I don't even like my pipe anymore.
